title: Turkish avalanche rages down a ravine in Kackar Mountains
title_page: Turkish avalanche rages down a ravine in Kackar Mountains | Daily Mail Online
text:
A giant avalanche engulfed a Turkish mountain as a stunned onlooker captured the dramatic moment it headed towards people's homes.
Recent warm weather and rainfall has melted the snow in the Kackar Mountains, above the Black Sea coast in eastern Turkey, and caused the spectacular avalanche.
During the tense video, the combination of snow, ice and rocks rapidly fell down the incredibly steep mountain at a high speed.
The snow, ice and rocks (pictured) started to make its way down the mountain in Ayder, Turkey
At one point, it looked like the avalanche was about to hit a small hillside retreat which included a number of houses and buildings.
But reports online suggest that the mass ended up in a river and it is unclear whether anyone was injured following the dramatic incident.
Hotel manager Fatih Yaylaci, from Ayder, Rize, Turkey, captured the dramatic moment and uploaded it online and it has been shared almost 2,000 times.
